alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Outagamie; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 11 at 2:59PM CDT until April 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Wednesday Afternoon... .Record to near record warm temperatures, in combination with winds gusting in the 25 to 30 mph range and minimum relative humidity values nearing 30 percent are leading to the possibility of critical fire weather conditions occurring across east-central Wisconsin. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR POSSIBLE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR EAST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN... The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Wood, Portage, Waupaca, Outagamie, Waushara, Winnebago and Calumet. * TIMING...From Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 31 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 70s. * IMPACTS...Fires will start easily and spread quickly in these conditions. So outdoor burning should not be attempted. Visit the Wisconsin DNR website at apps.dnr.wi.gov/wisburn/#/BurnRestrictions and click on the appropriate county to view current burning restrictions.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions may occur. A combination of strong winds, very low relative humidity, warm temperatures, and exceptionally dry fuels may create dangerous wildland fire conditions. Firefighters, emergency management, and law enforcement should monitor forecasts for updates on this potentially dangerous wildland fire situation.

area.areaDesc: Calumet; Outagamie; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood
